review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: I was given this gravity filter new as a gift and had suspicions on the design where the hard plastic at the base meets the soft bag. I even did preventative taping recognizing that this could be a weak spot. Despite this, and packing it gently, it still separated at this seam within 1.5 days of use on its first 3 day trip. Super disappointed.
review.name: Broken on first use

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It was amazing loved taking it hiking with us. It kept the water clean for drinking definitely a camping or hiking must have
review.name: Works great

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall, I am pleasantly surprised at the simplicity and utility that the Peak Series LifeStraw has to offer. I’m convinced that it’s a worthwhile staple for anyone who spends a lot of time outdoors.
review.name: Great idea

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how convenient this is and how easy it is to use. I love knowing the water I’m drinking is filtered and this water bottle is convenient to use. I can’t wait to take it out on a camping trip.
review.name: I like it!

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody:
I rely on Lifestraw products around home and when I travel because of their effectiveness in filtering out even the smallest bacteria. This filter system is also really compact for packing so it’s a very helpful addition to Lifestraw options.

I should also mention that the first one I bought had a terrible chemical smell but I was easily able to return it for a new one that has no odours, as it should be. Thanks to the very helpful customer service team.
review.name: Great option for filtering water when travelling

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I took the LifeStraw - LifeStraw Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System; 3L with me on a hiking trip and honestly I was drinking water out of the bottle. it was kept fresh the whole time and never put off a nasty taste as some packs do.
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this product. It’s very useful for camping situations as it helps to purify the water. I would recommend to anyone
review.name: Gravity filtration

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Life straw is the best for the go. Take it when I’m hiking 🥾 and get to use it on the river. Cleans perfectly and it’s easy to use 💯. The water gets filtered very clear water so I love it 💯🏕
review.name: Life Straw series

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used it once. And I can definitely tell that this is a lifesaving gadget. Especially in the modern world. I really value the products that life straw creates. It is literally a life straw
review.name: Something we don’t think about but need to be prep

review.itemreviewed: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is really amazing, it makes the water taste like it came straight from a water bottle that I bought. I would definitely recommend this!
review.name: Amazing!!

name: Peak Series Compact Gravity Water Filter System - 3L

review.reviewBody: I’ve now subjected these to a field of devils club, blackberry bushes, downed trees and multiple streams and they held up very well. At the end of the day, I was still dry so I’ll call these a win. The sizing was a little larger than expected but I put them over long underwear and my hiking pants and then the fit was pretty good.
review.name: Holds up to harsh environment

review.reviewBody: The pant itself was comfortable, very lightweight, and waterproof on a 8 mile drenching hike BUT the 3/4 length side zipper is not easy to get off. My boots were covered with mud when I tried to get these off without remove my boots and I got mud all over them. Make these full zip off on the sides. Another person on my hike had full side zips and was able to remover her pants easily and without getting mud on them.
review.name: 3/4 side zip is not easy on/off

review.reviewBody: They are waterproof but cold if you wear them with no lining on legs.  Also, there seemed to be a little static with the pants clinging to my socks until I rubbed a fabric softener sheet over my socks a little.  When I was out, there was only a slight drizzle, but they did a good job all except for the fact that my legs were cold in the 50 degree day we were having.  I should have worn some silk long underwear that I have, or some of those silver lined long underwear or leggings of some sort.  They seem to run true to size.  I wish they weren’t quite so full in the legs.  And why do they have to have the brand label in the middle of the thigh?  Really?  I wore them for a long walk and then out to eat and long walk home and I felt like I would have been more comfortable at the nice restaurant we were at if I didn’t have hiking pants on.  No one would have noticed they were hiking pants if they had just been plain black.  I took off a star for that.
review.name: True to size waterproof pants that aren’t too swishy sounding.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and feel. I have been looking for a shell layer to wear for all seasons of hiking in the northeast. These zip up the sides for ease of layering in the winter and will be great to protect from wind and rain
review.name: perfect outer layer

review.reviewBody: Great fit and feel of material.  Would highly recommend these pants.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Love how these fit, feel good to wear especially over tights or thermals. I found they were more comfortable to wear with layer or tights underneath.
review.name: Nice fitting, versatile, and comfortable, waterproof pants.

review.reviewBody: I loved  loved the fabric and everything bout them! I am 5’2 128 lbs. The medium just did not fit. A taller friend than mine loved them and bought them from me.   So short problems!
review.name: Awesome pants… just being short problems

review.reviewBody: Ozonic Pants. Haven't tried in the rain. Don't follow sizing instructions to size up. I had to size down a full size.
review.name: Finally invested in nice rain pants.

review.reviewBody: These pants are light weight and very comfortable. Keep me dry. Long zippers are great. Pocket for phone. Love them. I am 5'5'' and bought the short length which works well.
review.name: Great lightweight rain pants

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight packable pant thats stretchy. The fit is quite loose (maybe so you can layer over heavier weight pants). I sized down and bought an XS and layer over leggings comfortably.  5ft,5", 123lbs.
review.name: lightweight & packable

name: Stretch Ozonic Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Sometimes the little things can make a big difference. In our sport millimeters matter. I changed out my bottom bracket, not due to any specific need, but just the itch to do right by my trusty steed.
With that, I upgraded from a Shimano Ultegra BB to the Dura-Ace. The project in and of itself was very straight forward. Components came out and went in smooth as butter...
Winter weather is upon us in MD and the bike has been committed to the Hammer trainer until further notice. (Crap roads+wintry mix weather+poor roads=NO THANK YOU!) Been really enjoying some serious SufferFest workouts, and this bottom bracket is getting a serious breaking in period. It's fantastic! It feels as smooth as can be and those NM workouts are having me put some serious watts through those cranks. Nothing of note to report aside from utter satisfaction.
A nice upgrade for an insignificant cost. I enjoy doing my own wrenching, so this was fantastic buy!
review.name: The Little Things

review.reviewBody: Got this to replace an old Ultegra bottom bracket for an Ultegra crank because of crinkly creaking during hard pedaling.  Would have be fine with another Ultregra bottom bracket, but out of stock.  Threaded into my Pinarello F8 bottom bracket properly, tightened up and torqued in as expected.  Cranks installed as expected and spin smoothly.  Creaking during hard pedaling went away.  Have had it on for about 300 miles so far.  Pretty cheap solution, and now I've got some Dura Ace on the bike!

Layer that I feel like shows throw a little. I got it in black and I think it’s slimming because of the shorts underneath that act almost like shape wear.

hasVariant.name: SteriPEN Ultra
hasVariant.description: Buy the SteriPEN SteriPEN Ultra online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I used this product many times during back country camping and hiking trips to purify water in my personal water bottle, while on the trail. it is compact, easy to use, fast acting and performs. 
For large volumes of water use something like Katadyn Gravity Filter.
Because this product is compact and easy to use, hiker with any level of experience can use it.
Safe drinking water is a must a successful outdoor adventure.
review.name: A must have for a backpacker, hiker, traveler.

review.reviewBody: Best options to make suer clear water is safe to drink. Love it!
So easy to use I thought I’d get sick drinking water out of mountain streams.  No issues. Inadvertently had to drink out of a stagnant pond, tadpoles and lots of animal “signs”.  No problem.
review.name: Central America approved

review.reviewBody: Great product. I used it several times to purify water with. It works!!!

I relied upon a UV pen to treat many liters of water  on the Inca Trail hike and in my hostel in Cusco, and neither I nor my companions had any GI issues.

I have had the same great results in Mexico and on my tour down the Great Divide Mountain Bike Route.

And- it makes a nice gift for adventurers, even children, because it’s simple to use: submerge in relatively clear water, press a button, and stir.  

I carry extra batteries, but have never had to use them on a trip, and the case gives me confidence that it will survive in my pack.
review.name: Perfect for dodgy water

review.reviewBody: I used this item for a 12 day backpacking trip in the Wind River Range in Wyoming in late August - early September. Although it functioned as expected in warm temperatures, it did not work consistently in temperatures in the 40-60¬∫F range and not at all in lower temperatures. Even if I stored it in my sleeping bag and jacket pockets and pre-warmed the batteries against my body, the device would immediately cool down and cease to function upon use. This renders the pen worthless in most backcountry contexts. Thankfully I had some trusty AquaMira as a backup, and I resigned to using that most hours of the day.
review.name: does not function in cool to cold temperatures

review.reviewBody: I took this on my recent elk hunt and pulled water continually from streams all week long.  NO issues with the squirts or sickness so I feel the pen worked perfectly.  No issues with the batteries, size or durability at all!
review.name: 7 days and NO intestinal issues!

review.reviewBody: I've tried it in water bottles, nalgenes and even cups. The light will turn on for about 10 seconds then turn off, then I'll get a picture of a light bulb and a frowny face. Apparently the bulb is dead or been damaged right out of the box. Probably stick to a filter or tablets after this. Ended up having to drink snowmelt, lesson learned
review.name: Bad quality control, not reliable
comment:
Hey Cody,

Sorry to hear about the QC issue you experienced. I hate to hear that this faulty product caused you to drink snowmelt. I've emailed you to find a solution to help make things right. Thanks for your review!

review.reviewBody: Easy and compact. Saves me from carrying water weight the bike.
Great backup system that is small and charges off usb  Always keep it on hand if our filter fails.
review.name: this is my backup water system

name: SteriPEN Ultra

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is great for 25 F by itself. True to size. Excellent quality and confort. Lightweight, durable and packable.

This jacket has become my everyday jacket here in Montana.
review.name: Great for Montana Winter

review.reviewBody: I thought this jacket looked like it would be very warm and fit my needs. It is a "nice" jacket BUT 1) It does not take into account other than "downhill skiing!" The cuffs are VERY tight and do not allow for the use of a "smartwatch," which has to be outside the cuff to be seen for distance running or walking.2) The hood, fitted for a "helmet" is SO large that when pulling the drawstring for closeness around the neck, obscures one's vision and "pooches" out behind like ... a huge bump. I want to return as, even though I "ordered it" one day beyond the 30 days, and it wasn't actually "delivered" less than 30 day ago, I CAN'T. A VERY EXPENSIVE MISTAKE!
review.name: I VERY MUCH DISLIKE this jacket!

review.reviewBody:
This is my FAVORITE jacket for winter! I hadn't expected to love it so much. I use it for everything! Especially when it's really cold out. I use it for walking the doggo, hiking, or going to the bar with friends. The fit, especially the cuffs, is what I love most. Call me picky, but I feel like a lot of jackets have the velcro adjustable cuffs, that I hate. But this jacket, has elastic cuffs that fit snug and comfortably at the wrist. I'm telling you, it's a game changer!
As much as I love it for around town, it also can perform. So if you are looking for an all-in-one jacket, this should be your first pick.
review.name: My FAVORITE Winter Puffy!

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket so much, I don't know if I'll ever buy another puffy jacket again. 

I bought this jacket with cold-weather climbing pursuits in mind, which is what it is made for and really excels at. I love the dual-zipper that lets me belay comfortably off of my harness while wearing it and the helmet-compatible hood. The 800-fill down keeps me toasty at the crag, and since this jacket packs down into its own stuff sack, I even bring this jacket with me on days I don't think I'll need it just in case! (Side note - for those crag cat naps, the jacket in the stuff sack makes a great pillow!)

While I initially got this jacket for climbing, this jacket has become my everyday jacket. I wear it climbing, walking the dog, hiking, running to the grocery store -- if there's an opportunity for me to wear this jacket, I'm wearing this jacket! I have even had the chance to test the waterproofing on this jacket, and while I wouldn't recommend it in a downpour, it kept me dry in both a light rainstorm and a heavy snowstorm! Here in Utah, it is important for me to have a jacket that will keep me warm and dry in any condition I'm caught in, and this jacket does it all for me. Plus... I always get tons of compliments on the color!

The bottom line is, if you're having a hard time deciding between this jacket and another one, the Rab Electon Pro should be your choice.
review.name: My Go-To Puffy Jacket

review.reviewBody: The sleeves are long! And the sleeve cuffs are so comfortable. It feels very warm when I wear it! Which is amazing for how light weight it is. For comparison, I got this to replace the Arcteryx Thorium jacket, and this jacket feels the same weight (even with a hood whereas the one I've had is hoodless) and this jacket feels much WARMER when I wear it. The material feels very durable.
review.name: Lots of reasons to LOVE this jacket

name: Electron Pro Down Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Party Mod Snowboard - 2024

hasVariant.name: Party Mod Snowboard - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rome Party Mod Snowboard - 2024 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I wanted a board I could "mess around" with. The Party Mod does the job.

This board makes cruising on the slopes easy, handles parks & side hits flawlessly, and takes powder, slush, and icy surfaces well altogether. Flex rating is 6/10 on Rome's scale, but to me, it felt a little stiffer than that.

Pros:
- Easy to initiate turns.
- Feels lightweight.
- Jumps feel great popping off.

Cons:
- Chatter when going at high speeds.

Party Mod makes it fun to snowboard and does what I intend to do on the slopes, which is to have a great time. I'd highly recommend this board to intermediate snowboarders looking to improve their ability to have fun.
review.name: Good board, fitting name. PARTY MOD!

review.reviewBody:
Got this board a few seasons ago and was blown away by how explosive the board is. The pop from the carbon rods really sets it apart for a flat to rocker board. It's super loose and playful but can still rail turns at any speed and tackle fresh pow. It really turns the mountain into a playground like no other board I have ridden. Turned my quiver into a dust collector. 
Plus their customer service department is the best I have come across, sold for life.
review.name: So Sick

review.reviewBody: The board I want to ride all the time!  Deep days? Yep.  Mountain is tracked out? Have a party in the trees... Park laps? Got you. Not recommended for super hard packed or icy days- but on small amounts of fresh to double-digit dumpage, this board will guarantee you a GOOD TIME.  Advanced rippers and all riders looking to progress can step to and enjoy this Party.
review.name: Funnest ever! Quiver killer!

name: Party Mod Snowboard - 2024

review.reviewBody: Wonderful cooler. Great for off-roading. Fits in the back of my side by side, and it is easy to clean after a day on the trails.

review.reviewBody: We used this during our drive down the Alcan. BIG FAN. Kept our food cold for days. Bought only two bags of ice during our 9 days of travel. review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect fit for me. Also, the weight is distributed in a great way.
review.name: Perfect fit for me. Also,

review.reviewBody: It fits in the overhead compartment of all the flights I've been on so far! Solid interior packing space, and the detachable bag fits comfortably under the seat in front of you on the plane. Fits my laptop, a light zip-sweater, glasses, pens a small notebook, and room for more. I love that the laptop compartment doubles as a water bladder holder for day hikes. 20oz yeti Water bottle fits snuggly and securely in mesh bottle carrier.
review.name: Great traveler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] overall aesthetic was minimal and pleasantly clean | general functionality, especially in regard to back support and convertibility was great | the integration of the day pack has the right intent but was not as secure as desired, especially when both fully packed and connected | the day pack chest strap broke day one
review.name: overall aesthetic was minimal and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pack was exchanged for the Farpoint 55 as I was wanting a pack that could be used as a carryon for air travel. If able to check a bag, then this pack is the one for you!
review.name: This pack was exchanged for

review.reviewBody: This bag is worth every penny. I've had my for about 10 years now and it has never let me down. I mostly use it for backpacking and have taken it through Central and South America and several times to Asia. The detachable pack is a game changer. It's easy to fly with and comfortable to wear. Some of the clips and cords are starting to break down due to so much wear, but I expect that given the amount of abuse it has been through. I'm very happy with my purchase and will likely be getting a new pack soon!
review.name: Best Travel Backpack Ever

review.reviewBody: I really don’t enjoy taking my rolling suitcase if I can avoid it, because between myself, my wife and son we would have a lot of luggage for two people to move, so I tend to take my farpoint with me to free my hands up and needless to say I’m a fan. It’s perfect for me and will use the daypack as a carry on or a pack for around town once we get to where we’re going. If you’re on the fence, it’s worth the purchase
review.name: I love mine

review.reviewBody: I've used this bag for 10 years now; the small pack daily and the large bag for a number of trips each year. It's worked perfect and held up great. Over time, some of the zipper cords have worn and broke, but they are easy to replace with other cord material. Fits a travel guitar if you put in first… which I take everywhere with me. Worth every penny.
review.name: 10 Years of Heavy Use!

name: Farpoint 70L Backpack

review.name: Great multipurpose day hike bag.

review.reviewBody: Nice hip strap and my phone fit in the hip strap pocket. The side mesh pockets are not deep enough to hold a water bottle tightly.  The front mesh pockets are not functional - can hold a map or a snack - but not a much else.  There is no rain cover (at least I couldn't find one), which I would expect given the price.   I'm only 5" 1"  and the shoulder straps are too wide for me.
review.name: Excellent Quality.

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this pack to replace an old Gregory Jade 28. It’s the most comfortable daypack I’ve used, and it ticks all the boxes for me: comfortable, amazing adjustability, durability…and it actually fits my female frame. It fits so well on me it feels like the pack is an extension of my body. Even though it’s 20 liters, and some may not need the hip belt, it’s a must for me. I’ve passed over many small daypacks because they lacked a hip belt and the ability to adjust the torso, so I am thrilled to have found the Coulee 20. For reference, I am 5’6”, 115 lbs with a 27” waist and the XS is perfect. I’m looking forward to trying out other packs from Mystery Ranch!
review.name: Most comfortable day hike pack

review.reviewBody: The durability of this bag seems to be great, however, from looking at the photos I thought it would be larger than it is. There’s also only one secure pocket which is a bit frustrating.
review.name: Lack of pockets and small

name: Coulee 20L Backpack - Women's

review.itemreviewed: North Down Fleece-Lined Short Parka - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I couldn't be happier with the Boys' & Girls' North Down Fleece-Lined Short Parka! It's the perfect combination of warmth and style for colder months. The fleece lining is incredibly soft and cozy, keeping my child warm even on the chilliest days. My son absolutely loves how it looks on him and keeps mentioning how much he likes the style! The design is sleek and modern, making it a favorite for both of us. The lightweight feel offers excellent insulation without being bulky or restrictive, which is a huge plus. The water-repellent fabric is a lifesaver during unexpected snow or rain, and the durable construction stands up to all the rough-and-tumble activities kids love. Thoughtful details like the adjustable hood and plenty of pockets make this parka super functional as well. Highly recommended for parents looking for a high-quality, dependable winter coat that their kids will actually love wearing!
review.name: We love it

review.itemreviewed: Cruiser Tough 3-Piece CamLock Adjustable SUP Paddle - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
I recently bought the Red Paddle Co. Cruiser Tough 3-Piece CamLock Adjustable SUP Paddle, but unfortunately, it wasn't a great fit for me. While it seems like a well-made paddle (it boasts a durable construction and a CamLock system for easy adjustability), it fell short in a key area: length.

For my height 5'6", the paddle felt way too short, making paddling feel awkward and less efficient. This significantly impacted my enjoyment on the water.
If you're on the shorter side, this paddle might work for you. But for taller paddlers like myself, I'd recommend looking for a longer adjustable paddle to ensure a more comfortable and efficient paddling experience.
review.name: Not great. Perhaps for a beginner

review.itemreviewed: Cruiser Tough 3-Piece CamLock Adjustable SUP Paddle - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
I currently own 10 SUPs + 18 paddles. Recently bought a Red Paddle Co Tandem Board (which is great) and bought these paddles (which are crap) along with it.

These are easily the worst paddles I've encounted. They are worse than the basic $30 options available on amazon or your local big box sporting goods store. I can't fathom how RPC - who seems to pride themselves as an industry leader - sells such a worthless product. And they charge a premium each to boot!

The paddles are short. Shorter than all my other paddles (despite identical specs). Shorter than kids specific sized paddles I own. Too short for my wife and I who are pretty average height.

The clamps which are supposed to set the minimal height adjustment don't work. They use a phillips head screw to tighten the clamp, but the design has a built in upper limit to how much you can screw them down, and it isn't even close enough to secure the shaft in place.

Love my RPC board. But these paddles are frankly laughable at any price. Certainly not worth $150.
review.name: Laughable - especially at this price.

name: Cruiser Tough 3-Piece CamLock Adjustable SUP Paddle - Kids'

description: Buy the Ignik Outdoors Refillable Lighter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Refillable Lighter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ignik Outdoors Refillable Lighter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought one ,worked fine. second did not work.  cannot issue a return through back country websight. will not buy from them again
review.name: did not work

review.reviewBody:
I sought this lighter out as a greener, higher-quality alternative to disposable lighters for starting wood fires, grills, gas fireplaces, etc. 
It feels like a quality item in the hand--it's sturdy and feels well built. Unfortunately it's worthless. 
I filled this up with high quality butane and waited the recommended four hours. On first activation it shot a flame out nearly a foot from the lighter. A hissing sound continued for nearly 10 seconds, as compressed air and fuel continued to be expelled from the lighter. This is how the lighter works: one click starts a period of air and fuel shooting out, which cannot be stopped by releasing the trigger. Yes, that's right: fuel continues to shoot out of the lighter when you click it and it doesn't light.
After that, the lighter would not light again for many, many clicks, while the lighter spewed compressed air and butane the whole time. 
Eventually, I got the lighter to light and maintain a blue flame… which, honest to God, lasted several seconds before the fuel ran out. I refilled the lighter and repeated this pattern several times. 
Like I said, worthless. I would love to have the time back that I spent trying to get this thing to work.
review.name: Completely worthless

name: Refillable Lighter

review.reviewBody: First off I used the sizing chart and measured and these were exactly true to size, which was really nice. They don't move around while pedalling and the one crash they did take they protected super well. The mesh on the back is nice and breathable and they fit comfortable under several different brands of pants. Would definitely recommend these
review.name: Totally sold.

review.reviewBody: My first impressions have been crystal clear where my previous pairs left me wondering if I bought the right pads.  These pads are simply comfortable and provide a decent amount of protection.  I ride with pads anytime I plan on being aggressive and I love to jump and make bad decisions.  I have been searching for a pad that can be worn all the time and won't fall down when pedaling or crashing.  The Carves totally deliver.  I don't notice them when I am pedaling and in general didn't really think about them at all while riding.  This is a good thing!!  Having two straps is huge for someone like me that never quite fits into a size chart.  Most two strap pads are way to beefy and stiff for all day pedaling.  This pad is a perfect medium duty solution.  The only downside might be that they could be warm.  I find all pads to be warm so its not a big deal to me.  The foam feels great and is more flexible that my other set of impact foam pads.  Anyway.  These pads ended my search for the perfect all around all day pad that doesn't slide around.   Can't speak to the durability quite yet.  I usually wait to review products but these felt so perfect from the jump that I had to get one in right away.
review.name: Totally impressed.

name: Carve EVO+ Knee Guard

review.reviewBody:
Other packs were sitting too low, and this is perfect for me! 
I got the Haute Route S 30L Backpack. I’m 5’3
review.name: Great for shorter torsos

review.reviewBody: For skiing in the Wasatch range, this pack is a perfect do it all pack. I find myself grabbing this pack for short half-day tours up to full day tours covering long distances and a lot of vert. Some standout features that I love about this pack - two zipper pockets down the side of the pack for side panel access. really convenient to not have to unload everything from the top of your bag and grab whatever you need from the side access zippers. Convenient rope storage - one of the side panel zippers opens into its own separate compartment in the pack that can be used for rope storage if your objective involves rappelling. Cinch top closure - the cinch on the top of the bag is quick and convenient, no need to worry about getting a zipper snagged on this bag. Multiple ski carry options as well as ice axe compatible carry options.
review.name: Versatile touring pack!

name: Kume 32L Pack

review.reviewBody: Soaked pole in hot water and the old one came off easily!
review.name: Easy install

review.reviewBody: I have replaced flex tips several times in my BD poles (2 different models), they work perfect. Just keep in mind that to remove the old ones, you have to put them in very hot water for a few minutes, then are very easy to remove. Otherwise is close to impossible without damaging the poles.
review.name: new life for old poles

review.reviewBody: I am unable to get the old tips off my poles after precisely following instructions provided. Therefore, although there is nothing wrong with the new tips, they are useless to me. And sadly, the trekking poles are soon to be useless as well without functional tips.
review.name: No Go

review.reviewBody: Tip replacements work great. Super easy to put on the used trekking poles. Like new again
review.name: Perfect replacement

review.reviewBody:
Many miles of hiking with my Black Diamond trekking poles wore down the original tips making them slip when least wanted at times.

The ordering on-line and receipt of the Flex Tech tips from Black Diamond was super easy. The poles are as good as new now.
review.name: Trekking pole refurbish

review.reviewBody: Not as easy to remove the old tips but these new ones fit like a glove, like putting new tires on a car. Up the mountain I go.
review.name: Not as easy to remove

review.reviewBody: Able to replace my broken tip on my alpine trek poles. Took some work to swap, but bow it works great.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: With a quick YouTube video to learn how to make the fix. It was really easy to deal with. So far it’s holding up perfect as well.
My 8+ years old stick is now like a brand new. Works very well!
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I've broken several of these hiking here in the White Mountains of NH. Between all the rocks and the recent spat of icy weather, I've been slamming these tips hard breaking them, but I love the poles that are otherwise just fine. Took a little effort getting the old ones off (dip in hot water for a couple of minutes before trying to remove and use a vice grip or adjustable wrenches) but the new ones went on easily. Glad they're back in stock!
review.name: Cheap fix for otherwise good hiking poles

name: Flex Tech Tips

hasVariant.name: Cinturato Reinforced SmarTUBE
hasVariant.description: Buy the Pirelli Cinturato Reinforced SmarTUBE online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Took some of these on a 1800 mile self-supported road trip on a Kona touring bike (bike + gear + me = 250lbs). Used inside Schwab Efficiency tires. Despite the claims of being puncture resistant, I still had 2 flats vs none last year using Schwab Marathon and regular tubes. One case involved truck tire wires that littered a roadway. (The tubes won't stop a sharp wire apparently). But - they are much, much lighter than standard tubes and much more (10x) expensive ($35ea vs $25/6 standard tubes). Still - I carried 3 with me so I ended up ok (2 flats vs 3 tubes). Will continue to trial.
review.name: Reinforced SmarTUBE review

name: Cinturato Reinforced SmarTUBE

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Extremely comfortable, with a size runs true, they fit well and feel very soft on the skin. I've not yet worn them in extreme cold but I am 
confident they will work well to keep me warm.
review.name: Excellent Purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Surprisingly comfortable and keep me warm! For relaxing or workouts, this has been the best for me.
review.name: These pants are perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeps my legs warm in the most freezing temperatures
review.name: Warm thermals

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Listen, just buy them. I’m always skeptical paying a lot for anything but this is worth it. I don’t know why I question this brand as I own so much from them and they have never let me down. I’m from Texas and used these this Dec to a trip to Iceland where everyday was below freezing and these kept me warm. Now, was I as toasty as being in Texas? Absolutely not but I didn’t die, which for a Texas gal, was a concern. They heated me up and then wicked away my sweat when needed. Also, when they suggest the size, listen to them. I went a size up to a large instead of a med as suggested and should have went with the Med. I’m just at 5 feet and weigh about 145lbs which I carry most in my stomach, butt and thighs.
review.name: Just buy them

review.reviewBody: I have worn these several times for outdoor nature walks/hikes.  they are comfortable and definitely keep my legs warm, which then keeps my feet warm too!  I use 1-2 layers on top of them depending on how cold it is and how much I’ll be moving around with them on.  I’m looking forward to x/c skiing wearing them!
review.name: Warm and comfortable long underwear bottoms

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved it, it is really nice to wear and it keeps me warm!
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved it, it is really nice to wear and it keeps me warm!
review.name: Great purchase!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love all the Omni heat products. I'm from Florida so I can't take the cold. Someone clued me in to Omni heat so I will be utilizing these products on my trip to London in March. I know they're going to help me to enjoy my trip without having to worry about the cold. Great product.
review.name: I'm a huge fan of Omni Heat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect fit lightweight and comfortable. I wanted something that I can throw in my backpack for a trip I have to Peru. It was also important that it didn’t require to be iron or that it would get wrinkle it check off all boxes.
review.name: Comfortable & lightweight

review.reviewBody: They fit great, are 100% authentic , you can even wear them if you dress up, they are not too big nor too small. The only problem or issue I have is that they didn't come with a hardshell case just the Oakley bag along with the original paperbag box. So, other than that issue they are great.
review.name: Great sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
Based on several reviews, I was hesitant to purchase these beauties. I have been clinging desperately to my Oakley Daisy Chain shades. They are on their last leg...and not available anymore. 

Caveat fit me perfectly....I definitely have a medium sized dome (about 21.5 inch circumference and for sure a 4 finger forehead!)

This price is a steal for Oakley... and polarized lenses....? I might buy a second pair for back up!

I say, give it a go. You can always return them. Backcountry never lets me down!
review.name: Go for it!

name: Caveat Polarized Sunglasses - Women's

review.reviewBody: My 5 year old daughter prefers mittens so we decided to snag a pair of these for her to try out. For reference she got a Small and her palm measures 2.5" across the widest part. She's used them for general snow play, sledding, and skiing in temperatures ranging from low teens to mid 30s F. She says they are really soft inside, fit well, keep her hands dry even in wet snow, and best of all keep her hands toasty warm all day long. The "Guava" color is a bright pink that she loves. The over sleeve portion does well to keep the snow out and the wrist strap keeps them snugly on her hands. They also have a softer portion on the thumbs for wiping snot which is a nice touch. The quality is everything we have come to expect from 686.
review.name: Excellent mitt for little hands

review.reviewBody: As with all 686 products, these mitts deliver great appearance quality and performance. My daughter is 6 and mittens are a huge pain, but so far she’s excited about the purple print and able to get them on (at least one) by herself. I think they’ll do great to keep her hands warm on a really cold day.
review.name: Great Mitt for my 6 year old daughter.

name: Heat Mitten - Kids'

review.itemreviewed: Flanders 2 Warm Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear xsmall in all Castelli Wear. This fits me everywhere - except the head opening was wayyyyy too small. I ordered it twice thinking it had to be defective. But no - weirdly tiny. Had to order size up. And it la big on me. But is thin and warm.
review.name: X-small crazy small neck

review.itemreviewed: Flanders 2 Warm Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Very nice base layer, which has been keeping me warm when I wear it under my hard shell winter jacket in -5 to 5 degree Celsius weather. It's thin with a soft fleecy inside.

I would recommend ignoring the recommendation to size up from your normal US size, though. I initially ordered a size medium, since I'm usually a small or medium, and on the size chart I was between those sizes. It was really big. I ordered a small, thinking it would be crazy to go down to an extra small when the recommendation and size chart suggested a medium. The small fits pretty well on my arms and across my chest, but is definitely baggy around my waist. Not sure if the extra small would be better or worse, since I didn't want to go through returning another one, but from my experience I would say this base layer runs big.
review.name: Warm, breathable; sizing not accurate

review.itemreviewed: Flanders 2 Warm Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Women's
review.reviewBody: This undershirt was soft and cozy and the material felt comfortable like cotton. Love it.
review.name: Soft, thick, warm

name: Flanders 2 Warm Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Women's

description: Buy the Thule Vital 3L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vital 3L Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Vital 3L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: High quality and super comfortable, this is a great product
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Alright, this is the most comfortable hydration pack I've ever worn and I have tried many.  The low on the back design, functional side pockets, and hose magnet are the outstanding features.  All it needs for 5 stars is a quick-connect between the tube and the bladder.  The presents set up doesn't allow for easy bladder exchange or cleaning.
review.name: outstanding, however.....

review.reviewBody: This is a great Hydration bag, convenient and light but the reservoir last only 5 months, it ripped through the welded or heat pressed area at the edge of the bag, no way of fixing that and there is no replacement on the market. Completely disappointed.
review.name: Bladder replacement NOT available
comment:
Thank you for reaching out and letting us know about the issue!
Reservoirs in Thule hydration packs are manufactured by the company Hydrapak. Replacement components can be found through their website.

review.reviewBody: I've been trying many forms of hydration (bottles, waist packs, and hydration packs) trying to find the best solution to actually hydrate while riding, and provide comfort and convenience, on rough trails.  The Vital 3L hit the sweet spot of being super comfortable, even on demanding trails, while making it easy to drink.  Sitting very low on my back, and having mesh backing, allowed me to stay much cooler than any pack I've worn, it is even cooler than some waist packs I've tried!
review.name: This pack will make you love riding with a pack again

name: Vital 3L Hydration Backpack

hasVariant.name: Discovery View Dry Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the SealLine Discovery View Dry Bag online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Was great to keep gear dry and be able to see what is where in the bag.
review.name: Was great to keep gear

review.reviewBody: I love my new bag. You just have to make sure that you roll down the top sufficient times to ensure it stays folded.
review.name: Love my new View bag

review.reviewBody: ....as advertised. Well made and should be very durable.
review.name: ....as advertised. Well made and

review.reviewBody: Used these bags to store my clothing during my recent paddling trip on the Bowron Lakes circuit. They made finding my clothing easy. They were pulled in and out of my hatches at least once a day, for 7 days, without issue (no tears or punctures). They rolled up easily and compressed really well! And of course everything stayed dry.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: I use this bag to put towels in my jetski. It's perfect because you can squeeze the air out and make it fit even with the limited space a jetski provides and you can be sure everything will stay dry!
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: I am presently using it. I enjoy being able to see where my things are placed and being able to squeeze out the air. It is durable, strong, and is keeping my clothes dry in the rain.
review.name: I can see.

review.reviewBody: I used 2 of the compression sacks on a recent kayak trip, each worked very well, strong, and sturdy. They compressed my clothes and sleeping bag to a smaller foot print to allow items to be compactly stored in the hatch.
review.name: Compression sacks

review.reviewBody: I love how supple the material is and that the bag is clear so there are no questions as to where I put my paddling things. I always can count on SeaLine products to keep my personal items dry when I am out on the water. I highly recommend this item to anyone who participates in water sports.
review.name: I highly recommend this item.

review.reviewBody: Love the ability to see inside the bags before digging stuff out!
review.name: Love the transparency

review.reviewBody: I don't like the opaqueness since I can't see what's inside it. I use these bags for gear storage on my canoe and it is time consuming to open each bag and see what is where. Also the vent valve to expel the air during roll up isn't that effective especially if it is blocked by some gear. On a positive note I like the flexibility of the fabric which makes for a more compact fit up in tight spaces.
review.name: Discovery View Dry Bag

name: Discovery View Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: I got these matte roam as a replacement to my first pair. I thought I had reordered the same pair but turns out they are different and are don’t like them as much. I still like the fit but not the look. I would prefer the tortoise with the glossy finish and gold arms.
review.name: I got these matte roam

review.reviewBody:
Comfy, light weight

I like that the nose grips keep it right where you want them. Only con is you can see through to your pupils so you can’t give any mean mugs on the down low
review.name: Great pair of glasses

review.reviewBody: I was worried about the metal arms catching on my hair. But it doesn't. Great frame for smaller faces!
review.name: I was worried about the

review.reviewBody: These are light and also have a secure fit. I use them for trail running, mountain biking and leisure time outdoors. They're super durable, which is a plus.
review.name: These are light and also

review.reviewBody: The Roam sunglasses have been my go-to pair for years. My previous pair was still in fantastic shape after three years, when I accidentally lost them in the ocean. I blame the totally unscratched lens and natural look of the colors- I forgot I was even wearing sunglasses! The fit is on point, they're look great and I highly recommend them to anyone.
review.name: Feel Good, Look Good

review.reviewBody: They’ve got a great weight to them and the frames and earpieces sit snugly on my face (and I’m a man). I love the matte gold finish and tortoise shell look, and the chromapop lenses are honestly the best I’ve ever experienced. The clarity is unreal!
review.name: Honestly perfect shades…

review.reviewBody: Love these!! I have a very very small, usually child sized face, and these fit great. Use them for hiking and trail running and they don't slip. The colour pop is also awesome.
review.name: Love these!! I have a

review.reviewBody: Clean classic look. Solid materials and well built feel. A serious keeper.
review.name: Clean style

review.reviewBody: Love these. I got the tortoise frames and the lenses are magical. I got my dad to look through them and his comment was “Oh. Well, you’re living in a whole different world.” Everything is more vibrant and bright, yet protects the eyes. The nose pads are super effective for no sliding.
review.name: Wizard of Oz

review.reviewBody: The quality is awesome on these, they are a little heavier than previous smith sunglasses and the lens is a little darker than I would prefer. They are also a little tight for me. Overall they are made well and look great. Just not my favorite pair of smiths. I got the matte black polarized chroma pop black lens.
review.name: Nice quality, but not my favorites.

name: Roam ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: For any of these backloader bags...it is not meant for short riders. If your seat post is not high enough it will rub on your rear wheel. I had barely enough clearance (about two fingers apart) from my rear wheel to the bottom of this bag. On very bumpy gravel roads I had to stop and readjust the bag a few times. I also tried several ways to pack items inside (with heavy items in first), it still had to be adjusted. The cool thing about this bag is the compression bag that comes with it. Orlieb makes a similar bag with double straps for more security to the seat post.
review.name: Not Meant for Short Riders

review.reviewBody:
I used this on a bikepacking trip. I stuffed some extra layers and my  jet boil in there. Has a ton of storage, but I didn't need it all and it rolled down nicely.

Soild construction that should last for years  to come.  Strong mounting system to attach it to your seat.
review.name: Perfect for desert rambling

name: BackLoader Seat Bag

review.reviewBody: Having the exrta set of low light lenses is nice. Comfortable nose pieces. Light weight and look great. Will see how they hold up. Smith service and product are generally top notch.
review.name: Comfortable glasses multi function

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using the glasses for playing tennis in the sun.  They do the job well by reducing glare.  The frame is sturdy but light. But, be aware, these glasses are for wide “round face”.  For all others - they will probably fall off as you move.
review.name: Do the job well

review.reviewBody: The Leadout are an acceptable replacement for the king of all glasses, the Interlock Spoiler. The Leadout don't hug the face as well, but are comfortable after they are put on something to widen them for us large face folk. The real injustice is that Smith has so far refused to make Polarized replacement lenses. The Polarized Bronze Mirror and the Polarized Copper lenses that were available on the last generation of replaceable lens glasses were the ultimate in lens technology. Enhancing the world around you as you looked through them. Please Smith! Make those again!
review.name: Why Smith?!

review.reviewBody: Purchased the Leadout with the Photochromic Clear to Grey Lenses. Following Cataract surgery a few years ago, my eyes are more sensitive to light. The Photochromic lenses seemed at first to be too light, but I have experienced that they always darken just enough for comfort. The frames fit very well and edge coverage is excellent. I have a wide face. I do not care for the models with the wide temples that block side vision and these serve well. I've recommended them to several friends who appreciate fine eyewear.
review.name: Great Glasses!

review.reviewBody: Great service, great glasses! I honestly can highly recommend Smith, they are great
review.name: Great service, great glasses! I

review.reviewBody: Quickest easiest lens change system I’ve used- love the fit and the chromapop is great
review.name: Siiiick

review.reviewBody: Bought them for biking and outdoor athletics. Good coverage, comfortable and like being able to swap lenses. Bought the white frame with dark chromapop lenses, they also come with a very light tint pair of lenses which work well at night.
review.name: Still love the flexibility of pivlock for night and day riding

review.reviewBody: Fit a bit big. Sort of have a Thunderbirds feel, but not in a bad way, and it equals good coverage. A nice alternative to the massive windshield/retro/goggle trend in bike glasses.
review.name: I like.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for mountain biking, foraging, and hunting after being amazing by the optics with my 4D Mag chromapop ski goggles. These did not disappoint. I see so much more than with my bare eyes or my ray-bans. Fantastic.
review.name: Amazing clarity

review.reviewBody:
I use these primarily as motorcycle sunglasses. They are perfect because the lenses can be customized to the lighting conditions on the fly. It much easier than carrying around an extra face shield for my helmet. The glasses also fit well inside my helmet. 
Fit and style are great and Smith quality is always top notch.
review.name: Great glasses inside a motorcycle helmet

name: Leadout Pivlock Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: These fit great and are perfect when you have to dress up a bit yet keep your usual sporty self warm. I bought the first pair, lost the left glove somehow. Bought the second pair, again, lefty got loose. So, ordering my third pair now. If you have extra left handed gloves in M, send them my way... :)
review.name: Love these gloves -- this is my 3rd pair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I lost my first pair of these gloves on a trip through Ireland. Enjoyed them so much that I needed another pair exactly the same. Comfortable, functional, fashionable. They work great for driving and errands around town in the winter.
review.name: Love these gloves

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair for my wife, who liked them so much, she asked me to get a pair for my daughter, who liked them so much I got both of them extra pairs. They rave about the warmth, feel and style.
review.name: Great gift

review.reviewBody: well made so very warm, but thin and light so very versatile
review.name: Perfect for everything

review.reviewBody: Warm, functional, light weight, elegant and perfect fit!
review.name: Beautiful gloves.

review.reviewBody: I love these gloves! fits perfectly, i have small hands. it super comfortable, don't know the durability yet but it feels strong to me.
review.name: i would buy this again

review.reviewBody: These are comfortable and soft. I use them for driving mostly. I like the styling and think the touch fingertips work. The only problem for me is that the fingers are too long. However, that is only because I ordered a Large because I prefer looser to tight gloves. My choice, so not a product issue. They would not work for me in below freezing conditions but i wasn't expecting they would. They are for errand running and warmer mornings. I would recommend these gloves
review.name: Great Mostly

review.reviewBody: I am 15 5,8 110lb and wear 28-34 pants. I bought these in a small long because no other brand at the time had long/tall inseams in-stock. Anyways they do not have a 34in inseam as advertised they are more like 31in and the waist is huge. These are way to short and I will be sending them back.
review.name: SHORTER INSEAM THAN ADVERTISED :(

review.reviewBody:
First of all, thanks for making clothing in XXL tall!

I had the previous version of these bibs and loved them. I was psyched when I saw the re-design and with good reason. The added pockets and tweeking of the existing ones is great. Well thought out and super useful as I use them for work. With work in mind though,  why would you do away with the leg zips??? Kind of a key feature in any snow bib.  Would also loved to have seen  the ability to un-clip the suspenders which the previous version lacked as well. Overall good bib that could have been great.
review.name: Almost nailed it

review.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this outer shell jacket for snowboarding in Utah. I used a different jacket underneath for insulation and warmth, worked well without it being uncomfortable. I’m 6’2” and the length and size fit just right, the sleeves aren’t short or pulled up when raising my arms. The neatest thing about this, and if you have the Firefall pants/bib, is that there’s a hook inside the jacket near your tailbone. That hook attaches to a loop that’s affixed to the pants/bib so that the jacket doesn’t rise up if you should fall and down the slope while skiing/snowboarding.
review.name: Great Product for the Price

review.reviewBody:
These are the best non Gore-Tex pants ive ever had, which is a lot. Im 6' 1" and the L fits well, just a little baggy, but not dragging or interfering with my bindings. The only thing i dont love is the chest velcro, a zipper would be appropriate. No lace clip on the powder cuff, no back clasp hook. Love these pants. 
P
review.name: Best non gore-tex bibs

review.reviewBody: Outstanding quality for the price. These bibs performed perfectly during a backcountry snowmobile trip in Alaska. I stayed dry and warm all day despite the fact it's was in the single digits and lightly snowing all day. Great range of motion across the knee area and crotch, which is nice considering I'm 6ft-4in tall.
review.name: Outstanding bibs for cold snowy adventures

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband and he skied in them Saturday. He loved them. He felt warmer and had great mobility.
review.name: Husband loves them!

name: Firefall Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: it is quality made, but is too large.  Will have to return.
review.name: runs large

review.reviewBody:
This hoodie makes an excellent base layer in colder weather and as a single layer for warmer days. I used it for camping trips, hiking, biking and skiing; it's versatile, fits well and worked fine with a mid-weight ski sweater under my bibs. The hood is light and comfortable enough that I don't mind pulling it up when my ears get cold. 

This hoodie probably would've lasted a few years. Unfortunately, I have to order another one because it (and another one of my favorite sweaters) was cut off of me by paramedics after a serious auto collision. Luckily, there are some things that can be replaced. I'm looking forward to having this one again, and its practical comfort.
review.name: Soft, lightweight, well-made hoodie.

name: Verglas Shade Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I'm sure a lot of skiers would be pumped on this ski but it wasn't even remotely close to what I was hoping for.

The ski is extremely stiff. As in the flex pattern on the tip and tail is brutally unforgiving for the shape and purpose. The tail springs you forward as soon as it hits resistance and the tip is so rigid that it dives like crazy in soft snow. There are plenty of skiers who this ski would work for, but in a touring ski it's just not ideal to need to ride your tails to keep tips up and then have them be so stiff they buck you forward any time the snow varies. Even thinking wide open bowls I'd actually be nervous simply because it's still a little short for that at 184, and I have no confidence the tip won't bury itself if my balance moved off a perfectly centered stance.

Maybe a heavier skier than me, or skiers in heavier snow, would have a different experience, but in deeper soft power and shallow powder (sub 12 inches) these are all over the map. They punch right through knee deep Wasatch snow to catch on everything that's underneath. I'm used to a progressive flex pattern helping the tip and tail stay nicely elevated in that much snow; the stiffness on these staying consistent tip to tail causes them to feel like I'm balancing on egg shells.

Paired with the shape, which is a bit less progressive these days, it isn't pleasant to ski anywhere other than heavy or chopped up snow and the tail constantly wants to re-engage to accelerate downhill. It ends up working best as a resort charger which is exactly what I am not looking for.

The weight is fantastic and if you are looking for a touring ski that requires being on-point the entire way down this could be for you. As something that wants to be driven hard from the front of a boot, though, it just doesn't do what I'm looking for when touring in powder and is far too susceptible to tip dive and tail snags.

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the second pair of zippered Merrell boots we have purchased. The first pair we purchased a couple years ago were taller and worked well. The zippers on these boots don’t work. We’ve tried everything - Vaseline and repeated up and down zipping. The zippers were sewn in so poorly that they catch at the top and won’t go up and down easily no matter what we try.
review.name: Bad zippers

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boots are just what my husband needed. Fit well,  he sent them back to get a size up. The with reguulr and comfortable size 12. They should last a life time
review.name: Long, wait wait

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit at a great price. Ordered these online because I couldn't find them in the store.  Fedex lost the first pair but managed to deliver the second. Well worth the wait.
review.name: Well Worth the Wait

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Next to impossible to pull on. I purchased half size larger with medium width. I changed thickness of socks still impossible to pull on.
review.name: This is my experience

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This a decent product. 

However, you should have stuck to manufacturing the previous version of this boot. The  Primaloft, 400 gram insulation version - Arctic Chill Zip Waterproof Midnight was the better version of these two.
review.name: Good, but not the best.

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfy boots, easy to put on in a moments notice (I work in EMS). I've only been on ice and snow a little bit in these boots, but what I have experienced hasn't convinced me YET that they are great traction in such conditions. We'll see...
review.name: Warm, comfy, easy to slip on

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Je viens de les acheter et je les trouvent tres confortable et légere la seule chose que je ne sais pas sais si elle sont chaudes si quelqu'un peu me dire jusqu'a combien elle son chaude -10 -20--30.merci

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warmer than I thought they would be. Good grip. With even fitment elsewhere, they are a little tight over the arch of my foot, and sometimes the bellows near the zipper rub - but they do not feel cold near the zipper. They are quite (!) snug to get on and off. Verified waterproof.
review.name: Very good winter boot

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They were clunky.  Easy to get on and off.  I returned them because they didn't look very good.
review.name: Clunky

review.itemreviewed: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have started using this shoe as my go to farm shoe in the fall, winter , spring. Dew, mud, manure have a way of ruining any shoe but with very little care these shoes seem to come through easily. What really gets me is the comfort of a warm shoe that supports my feet in such a way that makes me just want to wear them over any other shoe. I can hose them off and easily slip them off when I come into our mud room. They might even be suitable for hiking if I get the time for that sort of thing.
review.name: Happy Feet
comment: We love happy feet! Thank you.

name: Coldpack 3 Thermo Tall Zip WP Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Bell Super 3R Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Super 3R Mips Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bell Super 3R Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: After beating up my first one of these, I repurchased it because I loved the fit and how light it was. I recently fell 15 ft off a bridge, face first, onto a tree trunk stump. A portion of the trunk made impact with my face which fractured my cheek bone and went through my cheek. However, the majority of the trunk was stopped by the helmet, and was ultimately the reason that kept the spikey portion of the trunk going directly through my face. Essentially, the helmet only allowed about 1-2 inches of the trunk to go through the hole of the helmet. The doctor said that had I not been wearing a full face, the trunk would've smashed my teeth in and the damage to my face would've been irreparable and life threatening. Oh, and I never lost consciousness or was concussed. So yea, I'd buy it again.
review.name: Saved my face

review.reviewBody: Pedal Strike cause me to face plant pretty damn hard. I can't fault the chin bar for failing because it did brake my fall and this was not a DH helmet. I still had to have my eye, lip, chin and ear stitched up. I'll give it a 5 star if I can get a discount on a crash replacement.
review.name: Crash review

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the size L to replace a size L Smith open face mtb helmet that I damaged. The Bell is a great design, the latches work well and looks like it is ventilated well. I was looking forward to this hybrid design. I removed the optional pads in front to give me the best fit at my chin, but the helmet was still squeezing my skull at my upper jaw. I compared the two helmets and I could see the big difference in widths. My old helmet of the same size was a half an inch wider than the Bell on the inside.

Idk if full face helmets are narrower by design compared to open, but it would nice to see this helmet just a little wider.
review.name: Great helmet design, just didn't fit me

review.reviewBody:
I can only attest to the size of this helmet. I measured my head (58cm) and, based on the size chart, I should be able to wear a medium.

I received it quickly, but unfortunately it's way too small. The chin bar is extremely tight around my cheek bones and chin, and the upper helmet was too small for my head. Thankfully, customer service is great - refund and return are super easy. They're shipping a Large with free 2 day shipping.
review.name: Too small!
comment:
Hi! How does the ?L? fit? 
My head is also 58 and I?m about to buy one, but have the same issue with the ?M?
Thanks!

review.reviewBody: I ordered this to ride at Trestle bike park this fall, overall a great helmet!  The MIPs system is great, and the helmet is very light and provides plenty of airflow.   It also protects very  well, I tried it on my first ride by clipping a tree with my bars that separated me from my bike rather violently and I plowed face and shoulder first into the trail.  Without the helmet I may have been looking at some dental work, but walked away with only minor scrapes and bruises on my shoulder.  Overall a great helmet, highly recommended!
review.name: Great helmet!
comment: Glad you're ok. Love Trestle but lots of opp's to smash face.

name: Super 3R Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: This jacket is great !! I received this jacket about a month ago and have been very impressed so far. It is very warm considering how light it is and very comfortable. The level of water resistance is more than capable for light rain and light snow.
review.name: My Shadow is AMAZN

review.reviewBody: Warm and light weight; my only complaint is the lack of zipped chest pocket found on most other mid layers and shells that OR offers.

The jacket is comfortable and mostly fits. When I purchased the jacket I didn't look closely at the sizing chart. The store offers a medium jacket, and that's what I needed with the exception of the arm length. I needed a medium/long, the arm's of the jacket are too short. The tag that is on the jacket has M/M which makes me wonder if the jacket may come in the correct size however OR doesn't offer it at the online store.
review.name: Sizing

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
Good insulation, stylish fit for city and outdoor wear, handles rain for upton3-4 hours 

Cons:
Zipper gets stuck and takes longer to dry once wet
review.name: Warm, stylish and water resistant for hours

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace a northface summit series. I love the inside pockets for gloves and hats when not in use but could use a chest pocket preferably on the outside and the hood is so tight it crushes a ball cap and if I have the hood up and want to zip the jacket all the way it’s so tight I feel strangled.
review.name: Almost Awesome.

review.reviewBody: I wore this on the AT in the evenings. Lightweight synthetic filling that will keep you warm and comfortable. Large inside pockets and and very flexible.
review.name: Warm and light

review.reviewBody: This coat is definitely high quality, but the fit is odd on my body. I know that isn't ubiquitous, but it is certainly something to state. OR is generally quite high quality, so I am, as usually, happy.
review.name: Decent coat

review.reviewBody: This is now my go-to mid-layer for snowboarding, workhorse layer for high exertion mountain hikes and around town choice when it's not cold enough to warrant the big puffy.
review.name: Exactly what I wanted this jacket to be

review.reviewBody: Got this as a warranty replacement for the Ascendant jacket. A long time favorite so I was bummed to learn they don't make it any longer. This is better than the Ascendant. Surprisingly warm in windy conditions, light, stretches and is breathable. DEF recommended!
review.name: DEF Recommended!

review.reviewBody: The Shadow Insulated Hoodie has been great so far, has kept me comfortable in light rain and windy in 30's as well as sunny with a cool breeze in the low 50's. I even wore it during spring skiing at Sun Valley when I forgot to pack my shell, and it performed wonderfully.
review.name: Perfectly Versatile

review.reviewBody: Would have. Expected these to last longer. Very disappointed. Not a great way for entry level folks to get introduced to climbing when the gear lasts only 3 months...
review.name: Sole separation in 3 months

review.reviewBody: Low cost and really great platform to learn and build on for bouldering and top rope. It fared well outdoors but I think is meant as a beginner gym shoe. The rubber isn’t phenomenal but that’s expected. The shoes are cheap and the sole peels later into their life. But true to your street size and enjoy learning on these. They’re good at smearing, edging, okay and heel hooking, okay at toe hooking, offer good friction with correct form
review.name: Amazing beginner shoe

review.reviewBody: The two shoes I bought both are labeled 42.5 but the right is noticeably larger.  See attached photo.  Very disappointed from a brand as well known as La Sportiva!
review.name: Shoes are different sizes!

review.reviewBody:
This was my first set of nuts,  I purchased approximately 5 years ago. They have held up extremely well and the price cannot be beat. I enjoy how the wires do not tend to bend/twirl around themselves or hold a memory of the last placement. I used nail polish to mark the sizes to make it easier for identification and did not see the lack of anodization as a negative to the set. 
Pros: 
--> Very Affordable 
--> Durable Wires that do not easily kink
Cons: 
--> Slightly heavier than some brands, but this is splitting hairs in my opinion.
review.name: Classic Rock Set - Affordable Set

review.reviewBody: As others here, was looking for a beginner set to add to the rack these are numbered and really a great price to add on. well made and is another set to choose from.
review.name: Great set

description: Buy the Nomatic Carry-On Classic 30L Travel Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carry-On Classic 30L Travel Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nomatic Carry-On Classic 30L Travel Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just came back from a trip using the carry-on and was impressed. Great material, quality, and organization. I would recommend.
review.name: Stand by my purchase!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I travel weekly for work. Love this bag. It is hard to innovate on a carry on bag as you want to keep the build simple but the magnetic straps are a really nice touch. Wheels roll effortlessly. My only complaint might be the beveled corner, while stylish, does eat some space and the hold down mesh for the straps is a bit awkward as it comes off the straps.
review.name: Fantastic Carry On

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The sleek minimalist design is right up my alley! I purchased the olive green after accidentally ordering the almond (which was more of a subdued lighter gray…in person), did a full return of it. 

My main gripe, which I only realized after the fact, and after hours of researching/comparing/watching reviews etc, was this carry on doesn’t expand at its very small 30L capacity (which also isn’t entirely accurate with my packing needs). The check in does, which I also purchased- very difficult to do as there is some strapping and unzipping you have to do.

For this price point and how/what I pack and use roller carry on luggage for I would’ve at least expected this. 5-10L possibly? The volume is decent but because of how the inside lining eats up space specifically where the handles are housed doesn’t give you much space to pack your belongings!

Aside from that, the handles 3 positions had no issue with nor the moving up and down of it. The zipper built in lock was a really nice feature. It rolls and turns and spins really smoothly tilted or fully stood up. And it does look really good in person!
review.name: Good but not great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great carry-on. Completely organizes my belongings
review.name: Great carry-on. Completely organizes my

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best carry on I own!! I love how it is minimalistic but packs all the features. I use it for my trips that are anywhere between 3 to 10 days.
review.name: Best Carry on I own!

review.reviewBody: Love the Design of the suitcase . Carry On is Light weight Sturdy and roomie... I was even able to Decorate for Hubby and I..
review.name: Sleek and Light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag. Last luggage you'll ever need to buy. Cannot beat the warranty and service.
review.name: Perfect Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have only taken one trip since purchasing this bag but like our other Nomadic stuff we love these as well. We love how light they are. We do wish the handle seemed a bit more stable but overall great quality.
review.name: Super Lightweight

review.reviewBody: bag seems solid. We will see how longevity is. My ONLY gripe so far. And I hope they make a v.2 of this. BUT, I wish the zippered enclosure/compression panels would swap sides. The collapsible handle takes SO MUCH space inside. It makes more sense to have the compression panels on the larger side. So you can really fill it. Then toss small loose things in the zippered side.
review.name: Almost perfect.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A very well organized bag with a few scuff marks makes it scratch and dent and a pn amazing deal for me. Very happy with my purchase
review.name: Great bag for the price

name: Carry-On Classic 30L Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: great fit and works well!!! only small note for improvement is the finger tips are not stitched down in the front so when you pull your hand out, the liner comes out almost fully withit. No big deal just would be annoying if you were in a hurry to put them on and the liner is jumbled
review.name: my bf loves them, great value too

review.reviewBody: I love the ability to use my pointer fingers with the warmth of a mitten style gloves.
review.name: Dexterity

review.reviewBody: On sale for a great price & arrived quickly. The liner mitt is better than I expected. Size is true to what I measured. Use these for winter fat-biking in Saskatchewan, Canada and they work very well. Nice and warm riding below zero degrees.
review.name: These are great 3 finger mitts

review.reviewBody: Very well made and it is generously sized, which is just what I wanted.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: These are pretty nice gloves. The liner is very nice and the exterior is well made. My index finger and thumb do get cold but not any worse than other gloves or mittens. However there is a design problem with the wrist leash. The Velcro that holds the liner in place tends to grab the leash so that when you pull off your gloves (for example while on the chairlift to check your phone) the wrist leash comes off with the glove. So no protection from loosing your glove. Fortunately I discovered this problem before dropping my gloves from the chairlift and I'll work around it in the future.
review.name: Pretty good but room for improvement

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for wind/rain proof gloves of enough warmth that I can bike in Oklahoma in the winter. Windchills well below zero and all of my fingers are still here
review.name: Very Happy

review.reviewBody: I have used these in the mid 20 degrees without the liner and was plenty warm. Good dexterity without the liner but with it may not be as good. The liner is a thicker liner which most likely would be warm to single digits at least (maybe negative temps as well) but I always carry a cheap thin liner as well in case it is too warm. I have not had these very long but they look durable. I do not buy gloves without the wrist leash anymore so it is a must.
review.name: Solid, well made gloves

review.reviewBody: Far and away the best, warmest mitten I've ever owned, and my husband agrees. We would buy again & again.
review.name: Please bring back the highcamp mitt

review.reviewBody: I got these gloves for climbing in the white mountains and they are warm. Even without the liners, my hands were toasty. Plus, they stayed dry, despite shoving my hands in the snow all day.
review.name: Quality mountain gloves

review.reviewBody: We love the Alti mitts but these are right there with them due to excellent functionality. I love having use of the 1 finger without sacrificing any warmth. If I use the liners I don't mind that taking the gloves on and off means that the liners come out every time, since if I'm wearing liners it's nice having them of when I take the mitt off.
review.name: Warm & Functional

name: HighCamp 3-Finger Glove - Men's
