review.reviewBody: Ordered a pair of the Dakine Slayer Elbow Pads in Large and could not get my hand through the pad.  I was not able to try out the pad as it did not fit. They look like they would be a robust pad but run 2-3 sizes small.
review.name: Runs very small

review.reviewBody: I'm a small guy and I ordered the mediums, literally couldn't even get my hand into them. They are ridiculously tiny. Also, they aren't soft at all, they are basically rigid. I'm sure they would provide good protection for a kid, maybe an 8 year old? They do seem well made though.
review.name: I think these are for kids.

review.reviewBody: Reviews are correct, these runs small. I ordered Large and it won't even pass through my forearms. The materials are stiff and not flexible.
review.name: Should have listen to the review.

review.reviewBody: I measured as medium for the upper measurement for the knee and elbow pads and as large for the lower measurement for each. I went with the large and am glad I did. I wear these mainly for lift-served downhill riding. If I were to use them for normal rides, I'd pull them down for the climbs and put them in place for extended downhill sections. They saved me the first time out. Two times down one run on some steep sharp corners my bike slid out and I ended up sliding on my knees and elbows. No abrasions, not even a bruise. Without the pads, I'm sure I would have come away with bad, bleeding abrasions.
review.name: Go with largest size measurement

review.reviewBody: I disregarded reviews recommending ordering a size larger. I should have listened. The measurements listed are incorrect. After exchanging for a large (I'm 5'11", 160-ish, lean build), I started using the pads immediately. Yes, you'll sweat in them, but they've stayed up on my arms (still a little snug, but not overly tight). I have had one minor crash since using them, and I landed on my elbow at an angle. They worked as advertised. For the price, and for not having adjustable forearm and biceps sections, they're a good buy.
review.name: Heed the advice and order a size up

review.reviewBody: They seem pretty well made but run very small.  I am 5?7?, weigh 150 lbs with an average build...not skinny but not crazy muscular.  I ordered a size medium and could barely get it Up over my elbow.  Super tight and just too uncomfortable to even try the other arm.  Sending back for a size large which seems crazy as I don?t wear a size large in anything.  Unless you have very skinny arms I would go up a size.
review.name: Good quality but runs small

name: Slayer Elbow Pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was perfect for my trip. I needed in a time crunch and it was delivered quickly. The functionality with attachable day bag was great. I love how the main bag opens like a suitcase and the straps to tighten it was so helpful. I am obsessed with the color too. Everything was thought of when designing this bag.
review.name: This was perfect for my

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack to backpack around the world and have used it for the last 9 months. 40L pack is excellent and durable. The inside and outside straps are a game changer to compress everything. The daypack is horrible!! The zipper only goes down 1/3 of the pack and makes it impossible to pack things/dig them out. Please fix it so the zipper goes further down like every other backpack. I ended up bringing a different daypack with me.
review.name: Durable but could be improved

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A great bag which holds more than it seems it should. Love the two pack combination and the quick transformation into a carryon.
review.name: A great bag which holds

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hi
We love Osprey gear and have a lot of it.
But my wife had issues with this pack.
The major issues were, the shoulder yoke is way to wide, she grew up a farm girl in Iowa, she’s not a waif. This looks like it’s made to fit a linebacker. Frankly, it’s way too wide and is awful after even a little while.
Also the load straps connecting the pack to the top of the shoulder strap don’t stay taught. This makes an already uncomfortable carry even worse.
Either one are game-Enders. Unfortunately we didn’t realize it until we were already in Portugal.

I’m going to call and see if there’s are any remedies. I hope there is.
Thanks
review.name: Hi We love Osprey gear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used two different models of the Fairview 55 and I prefer the old one, which had the zip in outer backpack and was longer and thinner in depth. With the new model, if it's packed full, it's really back heavy.
review.name: I've used two different models

review.reviewBody:
I don’t think this backpack is for everyone but for me it’s a game changer. I travel a lot with a work laptop, work clothes, and a second very big wheelie case with equipment. I don’t want two wheelie cases (awkward through stations) and I do want a separate laptop pack for work. This fits the bill perfectly. I had the previous model but I needed carry on. Delighted I made the replacement. 

When assembled the whole pack is a bit “Frankenstein” and it could use more pockets, but it works a treat, is well made, easy to use and an absolute game changer for me.
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable for 5'1", roomy, perfect for summer in Europe.
review.name: Comfortable for 5'1", roomy, perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love the osprey bag set. I take it everywhere when traveling. I travel for work so it’s great that if I end up buying stuff from my travels it can fit so many things. Also it’s so convenient to take with me because I can just get up and go. When I need a daypack it’s already attached, so I never have to worry about not having storage!
review.name: I really love the osprey

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fairview 55 is an awesome pack! I used it for my international travel to the Philippines for the first time. Very spacious and I like how it felt “lighter” on the back because of its back support!!! I love it!! The only thing is the lack of water bottle slot outside the pack in Fairview 55L. I have another 35L pack from a different company but I think I will use the Osprey Fairview 55L again because of the back support :)
review.name: Fairview 55 is an awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this backpack for my overseas travels. Overall, love it. I do wish it opened up more like a suitcase and not from the end, but even with that I love this backpack. So comfortable to wear. Easily fit in overhead storage on the airplane.
review.name: I bought this backpack for

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak Seeker 2L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great water bottle. Doesn’t leak and packs away nicely. Great for travel. I like taking it empty to the airport and filling it up once I get through TSA to have water for my flight.
review.name: Great bottle

review.reviewBody: I recently went on a backpacking trip to Sykes hot springs in Big Sur where I knew that 1.5 L water bottle is the minimum size I needed. I didn't want to carry a large collapsible bottle so I took this 2 L one with me. It's so easy and convenient to fill this one in streams/ rivers you can hold a bottle by the side handle and due to the wide 42 mm opening it's a breeze to fill in water there. I then clip a combo of different adapters: hydrapak Plug and Play adapter, hydrapak filter adapter, filter from peakgravity, and sawyer sp 150 coupling. Then I attach it to plastic water bottle and leave it or press on the bottle to speed up a process a little bit. So far this is a very convenient way to filter the water for me. Maybe not super fast but I feel safe with this setup.
review.name: Perfect for 1.5 liter bottle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well, the truth is that it is very good for taking it on a trip and it is very portable, it fits anywhere and has a good capacity. The material is what I didn't like very much, it feels very simple and the truth is that I was afraid to put it in my backpack for fear that it would spill.
review.name: Easy to fill and store
comment:
Hi,
Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it. Our products are made with TPU material and is used all throughout the industry for its food-safe properties and its durability. It should not spill in your backpack :)
Please let us know if you have any other concerns, we are happy to help!
Thank you

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We hike all the time and this has been just perfect. Specially the summer we bring extra water and this way when we finish it off I can just fold it back up in my pack and it’s just one less thing to carry. It’s also great to have around in case we are doing a longer hike. I need to refill water more than we thought, it just been very handy. It doesn’t leak and holds tons of water.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First I wasn’t sure about how I will use it since is the first time I use a plastic container…it works great! Take it to Disney where water cost what a mean cost!
review.name: Versátil and handy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I almost love it I love the concept of the bottle being so light and foldable that it can fold up in a small patch and can hold up to 2L of water but it is kinda hard to drink from since the bottle isn’t solid. And it doesn’t keep the water cold sadly.
review.name: Foldable bottle how cool!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used the Seeker 2L Ultra Light Water Storage. It is super light and small (fits in my hand). What a great container to carry if you need to be light weight and compact. The size is also amazing as 2 Liters is the amount of water I aim to drink a day. The material seems strong and resistant and the stripes on top and side allow you to carry it easily. I recommend this product.
review.name: Extra Light and Compact Water Container

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This feels like it will last fairly well with occasional use— it’s very light and folds down nicely if you’re hiking or camping it would be perfect. It did leak while full and in my bag, but I think it was squeezed a little from being in backpack while hiking. It was nice to be able to tuck it away once it was empty and not have to hold it
review.name: Good for Hiking
comment:
Hi,

Thank you so much for your response, we appreciate your feedback! We've deisigned the Seeker collection to be hassle free and easy to store, we are happy to know this works for you. If you encounter any issues regarding your Seeker (unsure leaking, broken cap etc) please file a warranty claim using the link below and we will help take care of you 
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=913128

Thank you

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pouch is amazing! very durable and convenient during outings and even for personal use😁 I would love to see more people try this product!!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Okay this is awesome! It keeps my drink colder than my water bottle and is insanely compact for how much water it holds. I love the handle! No leaking and very flexible. Doesn’t leave a funky taste on the water! The only slight flaws are that it’s hard to clean and I’m worried it could mold. It’s hard to get all the water fully out of it and keep the bag open when drying. But no issues with that yet! If it seems all good I’m going to buy 100 more of these for my camping friends and to put on my sailboat!
review.name: So convenient!

name: Seeker 2L Water Bottle

review.reviewBody: I didn’t know that snowshoes could be so sporty. I love my new snowshoes!
review.name: I’ve got a sports car on my feet!

review.reviewBody:
These snowshoes are an upgrade for me from men's Revo Explores. I like that these are narrower. I used to trip myself when the front inner corner of the Revo would catch the ankle of my gaiter. I like that my big feet fit into the women's version of the Lightening. My size 11 boots did not fit into the women's Revo bindings. That's why my last ones were men's. I like the more aggressive grip of the lightnings, especially when I'm going downhill. I'm always a little uncomfortable coming off a mountain. I feel much more in control in these. I love the Paragon bindings. So much more comfortable than the hyperlinks. My feet would always slip forward on the descent and then the heel strap would come off. I used to have to crank the rachet on the Hyperlinks until my foot hurt and they would still come off.
The only thing I find less satisfactory are the heel lifts. They are more aggressive than I like and because of my big feet my boot heels land on them very far forward. I do not feel very comfortable or stable when using them. Wish I could move them back a bit... I haven't decided if this is a deal breaker or not. I've only gotten to use them once so far.
review.name: Overall a good upgrade

review.reviewBody: These are the best at conquering some tough terrain. Rock fields, avalanche debris, side hills, these do it all. And you can be assured, they won't break when you need them most, far from any lodge.
review.name: Hardcore

review.reviewBody: These are everything I had hoped for in my next pair of snowshoes. They are so comfortable on level trails or when I’m gaining elevation, and I feel confident when I’m hitting the snow-covered trails now. Very easy to put on as well.
review.name: Great choice!

review.reviewBody:
Lack of snow to use our new Lightning Ascent Snowshoes
But we going to be ready for the next season
review.name: Lack of snow to use

review.reviewBody:
We bought two pairs of this snow shoes. It took a minute to get them adjusted for our shoes (I did at home), would recommend this. 
We finally got to get out on the snow as this has been a bad year for lower elevation snow. 
These snow shoes are awesome, coming from a not as well designed snow show, it was like walking on air, they are light and give you a lot of lift on the snow. 
Would highly recommend for anyone wanting a great pair of snow shoes that preform extremely well.
review.name: Awesome Light Weight Snow Show

review.reviewBody: I love the way these snowshoes are shaped and fitted for a smaller woman's body and gait. They are very comfortable without sacrificing durability and functionality. I'm very satisfied.
review.name: Women's Lightening Ascent Snowshoes

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a narrow snowshoe and was under the impression MSR was a reputable brand. These snowshoes have a severe rivet flaw. 3 have broken out of one snowshoe and 1 on the other underneath the foot binding. The rivet failure is not something any user could have caused. They simply do not last. I think the rivets must be either low quality or a poor design. This is not a long-lasting piece of gear.
review.name: Rivet failure

review.reviewBody: These were pretty straightforward to put on. I found them comfortable, but they are still very wide so that I had to walk with a wide stance so they wouldn't catch my pants. This made it hard to enjoy wearing them for longer than 30-45 minutes.
review.name: Easy to put on, hard to walk in

review.reviewBody: The snowshoes work great but the paint on the shoes started peeling off the first time I used them. My husband has a black pair he’s used more times than I’ve used mine and has no problem with the paint coming off. It’s disappointing to pay this amount for snowshoes that don’t look good after using them from the first use and the paint continued to come off each time I used them. More paint has come off since these photos were taken. I’m currently not at home but I could send more pictures next week if you would like to see what they look like now.
review.name: Work great but look bad

name: Lightning Ascent Snowshoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Flow Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love Salamon shoes but have shifted to some Hokas as I age. These shoes fill that void of a more cushioned trail shoe. I feel like Salamons hold up better to use so fingers crossed I'll have these for awhile, thumbs up!
review.name: Comfortable out of the box

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Flow Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I'm a fan of Salomon shoes, they are good quality and hold up really well. The Ultra Flow Trail Running shoes are lightweight and comfortable and so far they've been able to tackle any hiking trail I've taken them on. 
The mesh is breathable and the soles provide enough cushion and support to fit my needs.
The only thing to note is they seemed to run every so slightly big, but not by much. 
They are pretty stylish too, I love the colors they offer!
review.name: Cushioned and capable trail runner

name: Ultra Flow Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Purchased to increase rotor on Surly Lowside from 160mm to 180mm.  East to install and works as designed.

review.reviewBody: got this to convert 180 to 200mm sram guide RE, which has the CPS washer system, unfortunately I was unable to get the caliper height to be correct with this adapter and hardware, seemed like the pads were never really in the right spot on the rotor. review.name: maybe it will work better with shimano

review.reviewBody: There's a QR code that's supposed to take you to the install manual but it took me to a page with various notices/warnings but no information on how to install. It's mostly straightforward, however there's one piece where I'm not sure if it's an extra part... Pretty frustrated by Shimano's QR code manuals. I'll give it 4 stars for quality but not having basic install instructions isn't great
review.name: No Install instructions

review.reviewBody:
Purchased to go from 160 to 203 post to post.

No washers needed other than what came with it. 

Beat on the bike and it holds alignment just fine
review.name: Exact fit

review.reviewBody: I actually had to buy, return, and rebuy several times trying to find my right size. Backcountry honored the return each time, and I’m happy to say I finally got a jacket in my size. It’s an excellent jacket. I have Barbour from 20 years ago I absolutely love. I haven’t gotten to break this one in yet on account of the summer weather, but I’m certain it’s no lesser in quality from the one I’ve been wearing. For anyone curious, I’m 6”2, 200lbs, and about 20% body fat. The size 40 fits me perfectly.
review.name: Excellent Jacket

review.reviewBody: I purchased one of these on sale as a birthday gift for myself to replace a 10-year old Barbour Sapper rain jacket. Unlike the Sapper, this jacket is (1) made in UK and (2) runs by chest size, not S,M,L,XL. Immediately upon opening the package, I could feel the high quality construction in the jacket. The waxed cotton was, indeed, waxy, almost greasy feeling. The way the jacket rests on you feels sturdy and well-made. From what I had read beforehand, choosing the right size is the trickiest part with these jackets. However, I went with usual (not true) size and had no issues. My chest size is 38, but I typically buy one size up for coats (to consider having a bit of room for layering, as I tend to wear these jackets in the colder months). At 5' 9" and 165 pounds, with an athletic build, the 40 was just right for me.
review.name: Right As Rain

name: Bedale Wax Jacket - Men's

Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So warm! They are perfect, I wish they came in more colors.
review.name: High quality

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought size small, perfect fit. Length is nice for someone who is 5’2”. The waist you can make more fitted if you have a smaller waist which is nice!
review.name: Solid ski bibs

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
The maroon is actually more of a brown, which is a bummer. 
I got these a size up so I can fit some layers underneath. I would rather that they are a little loose than so tight I can’t move well. I don’t think snow bibs are meant to be flattering. 😂
They are a bit of a bootcut which I guess makes sense, but the flare is pretty serious.
review.name: Happy they are made in Short length!

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wonderful ski bibs. Lots of room to move. Love the omni heat.
review.name: Happy Customer

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice bibs. Comfortable and true to size. Order what you normally wear.
review.name: A step above the average

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered the size medium and it fit great! You can adjust on both sides, so it helps a lot to make sure the fit is comfortable.
review.name: Great Fit!

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These bib overalls are definitely not for me.  The fit was boxy and strange, the snaps are limited -- just two sizes with no in between.  Once I used the snaps to size the bibs down, the bunched fabric felt uncomfortable at my sides.  The pants legs are a little on the short side.  But the worst part about the design of these overalls for me is that the zippers are on the sides.  So to take them on and off, you have to unzip one or both sides and then duck under the elastic strap.  As someone who needs to use the bathroom several times a day, this would be an annoying and cumbersome process.  These are going straight back.  I will be keeping the Iceventure II Bib instead.
review.name: Not the right style for me

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am just under 6 ft tall and ordered this in a size Large, Long. My previous pair of Columbia snow pants lasted me 10 years, so it was a no-brainer to go back and try something else. This is my first bib. I recently ordered it and haven't used it while skiing yet, but I really do love it! Very comfortable, looks great, long enough for my legs, many pockets, and already feels as warm as my previous snow pants. Would recommend!
review.name: First bib - love it

review.itemreviewed: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so excited to find a well-fitting insulated bib in a short inseam that doesn’t break the bank! This tick all my boxes. It’s so hard to find snow pants that aren’t shredded at the bottom by the end of the season. It took a little practice to get in and out, as I am not used to having bibs with side zippers. For reference, I got  L short, and I’m 5’2” with thick thighs and a booty. :-)
review.name: Exactly what I spent forever looking for

name: Highland Summit II Insulated Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: My husband was over the moon to receive his new Patagonia Powder Town ski jacket for his birthday!  It's lightweight but wind/weather resistant,  has zippered arm vents, plenty of storage pockets, and it's his favorite color - what's not to love??
review.name: Primo Outer Ski Layer

review.reviewBody: This is more a review of BackCountry customer service. I ordered this jacket in a men’s L. They sent me a completely different item in youth XS. Called to explain and they told me they now were out of stock of the item I originally ordered. Very disappointing.
review.name: Wrong item delivered.

review.reviewBody:
Only shoulder and chest fit snug,  sleeve is too long and the jacket length covers my entire hip.
Returning this jacket.
review.name: The sizing is off.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The straps (?) meant for keeping the doors on the outer tent open leads water from the outside dripping onto the tent inside (like wicks). No big leaks, but in heavy rain it does cause the inner tent to become wet inside. I very much would like a recommendation on how to remidiate this without causing any damage to the tent or the warranty. I've used the tent two times, and i love it! A way to fix the leak would make it perfect!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Tiger Wall 3 Platinum Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this tent because the weight is so low, but yet still is freestanding without need for trekking poles. I?ve done a lot of research prior to purchasing it and this is the lightest tent for the money without having to use a trekking pole tent system. The Big Agnes Tiger Wall Platinum 3 Tent is an excellent quality tent that offers a great amount of room for two persons. I use it with my wife for backpacking trips and it has worked out great for us. The aluminum poles and stakes are made of DAC aluminum which is a major wight savings. The tent material is super thin but so far over the course of a few hundred miles no holes, punctures of signs of wear/tear. The zippers run well. The one complaint I do have about this tent is that the rain shield over the zipper often gets tuck in the zipper which is annoying. But for the weight of this shelter for two people is phenomenal. It has performed well and is really easy to pop up in about 5 minutes.
review.name: Worth Every Penny! I love this tent!

review.reviewBody:
TLDR: Buy it, you won't regret it.

After exhaustive research into the world of ultra light backpacking tents we settled on the Big Agnes Tiger Wall 3 Platinum. My wife and I spend over 30 nights under the stars each summer and we were looking to replace our non-free standing tent with something that would be a little easier to setup. If you are looking for a tent that is amazingly light weight while remaining durable and waterproof this is the tent for you. We've taken this tent to the Utah desert, Wyoming's Wind River Range, and to a very soggy Three Sister's Wilderness in Oregon just to name a few. The three person is the perfect size for me, my wife, and our dog. Even if it was just my wife and I, I think I would still go for the three person. I appreciate the extra space. At 6'2 I take up a lot of space but we don't feel cramped and I can sit up without hitting my head. This is one of the more spacious tents for its weight. There are vestibules on both sides and they are big enough to shield your gear and boots in a nasty rain storm. We didn't haven't had any issues with condensation building up on the inside of the fly, even in humid climates. Even after 5 days straight of Pacific Northwest rain, our tent remained dry. The is super light. Like, really really light. It's also very easy to setup which we appreciate after a long day on the trail. It's held just fine in strong winds. Comes with nice stakes. The interior pockets a good size and in a good location. We also really like the media pocket. It's way better than having our junk roll around the tent all night. One thing we ended up loving about this tent is that it has two doors. Many of the super light weight tents we looked at only had one and we don't like climbing over each other to use the restroom in the middle of the night. The floor feels thin but its held up perfectly against our dogs claws. The fly is also super thin, but does what it's suppose to. It took us some time to get use to how thin thy fly is, if you're not careful you can catch the fly in its zipper. Which is easily avoidable but just something to be aware of.
review.name: Love It

name: Tiger Wall 3 Platinum Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Can't wait for crisp fall temps to get use out of this. It's really nice! The polyester material feels like wool, and it appears to be very well made. It looks really cute with baggy cuffed pants and with the sleeves rolled up a couple of times. Only negative, I know it's a *shirt* jacket, but I wish it had hand pockets!
